comment: Laser-Hansen will make you worried on the first day that the class is impossible. She is presenting you with hard material, however it is important to write down each slide. She gives  you learning objectives that is a simpler version of her notes, then just put the 2 together. I recommend finding a study group they really are helpful and GO TO SI!

Great professor, she gives an outline of what will be on the test, everything comes from her PP which she doesnt post online. You will have to read and study the notes alot at least 2-3 before the test. Go to class, take good notes, and you should make an A. Lab is a totally different story. haha

This professor is a genius. She is so nice and will answer any questions you have. Lab is so hard, but its not her fault. She tells you exactly what will be on the practical, so no surprises. 1 midterm, 1final, easy weekly modules. You have to study the bones every week starting day 1 if you want a good grade. You get out what you put into it.
she's really smart and knows how to teach it. the class itself is super tough. Sometimes she's not very clear on what we need to know on the exams which can be extremely frustrating.

She's probably the smartest person I've ever met. She uses a test bank for some of her tests, but mostly makes up her questions because she is a genius. Super sweet, and wants you to do well. 3 tests and a final, VERY clear about what you will be tested over. TAKE HER, SHE IS AMAZING. A&P isn't easy, but she makes it interesting and easy to learn.

Prof. Laser-Hansen is great. The lab itself is extremely tough and there's a lot of memorization, but she's willing to help anyone who needs it. Great explanations for confusing topics, but you have to ask. She breaks down the midterm and final into how many stations per topic so you know what to focus on. Made the class a little more bearable.
Lectures are pretty boring, but you need to take notes. She knows her stuff, and there is A LOT, so study up.

T,TR class gets 100 multiple choice, diagram, and true false questions but you only have 1 hr and 15 mins to complete.  She will spend 15 mins going over the obvious before handing out the exam and will start the test late so you only have 50 mins or less to finish. Good luck with that.

Attended class regularly and had a hard time keeping up. The SI session was a joke and I spent a lot of time attending the practice exam sessions only to realize that all of the material was straight from Quizlet.com. Had for both lecture and lab. Looked at statistics for lab grades on exams and average was 64%. Not sure how this is acceptable?

She is awesome. If you can get into her class, I highly suggest it. I was so scared to take anatomy and I ended up getting high A's on every exam. Yes, you need to study your butt off, but it definitely pays off. You will be just fine in this class. I also suggest taking the MWF to have shorter tests.
she is very nice, lets u know ahead what will be on the test. posts what will be covered on the test. study, attend class and you'll get a A. i expected a C but she made everything so clear.
I like Laesar Hansen but she takes FOREVER to post grades, but other than that she is good teacher. You have to work hard.

I don't have anything against Dr. Laser-Hansen, but she is a very difficult grader. She will take points off for minute spelling errors. I plan on taking Tresham  for 2222. I have heard better reviews.

2221L (Lab). Very difficult. Not very helpful in lab. Doesn't label cats and you have to guess. Final exam you'll be tested on it and hope what you guessed and studied was correct. Would highly recommend taking someone else. Don't be fooled by friendliness- she'll eat your GPA!

Most difficult prof in dpt. No curve. Avgs for exams in the 60's and below. Nice person but testing style is erratic. More people fail than pass this class. Do NOT take this class with other classes if you need a good grade. This IS the weed-out class at Kennesaw. Know that going in.

Mrs. Hansen is a very nice teacher. I've had 3 classes with her. She explains anything you don't understand. The labs are harder because there are only 2 practicals, but that is regulated by the department, not by Mrs. Hansen. I would definitely take her again.

I had her for lab. Shes very sweet and helpful.  There's only a midterm and final though..they're difficult. I worked hard and got a C. 1/3 of the class dropped, and few ended up with an A or B. I think it's a challenging course in general, but those tests were too hard. Great person,but next time Id look for a teacher who gives more tests/quizzes.
shes really hard..dont take her if you have a better choice..but she does teach great..i guess its just a hard class..:S most of the class fails..plus u only have 2 exams to show how u can do..:S

Great lab teacher. She is very knowledgeable about her material, and will spend time with you if you have questions. She tells you exactly what you need to know for the 2 exams. Just read everything and practice.
